title: add temperature sensor DHT22
body:
I have add the DHT22 temperature sensor.
Its include a extra menu in Pfod. You can see now the temperature in the Settingsmenu and change an over temperature to shutdown the ardumower.

title: Fix turns with IMU in use
body:
- fixes issue where `random(PI/2, PI)` returns only 1 and 2 (thus only two angles of turn).
- roll direction and IMU roll direction is now to same in order to prevent turning to the left via right side
- debatable: in case of collision, robot rolls to the left or right by 90 degrees
- in case of random mode - turn direction also selected randomly

title: Could we pull this into the Ardumower code? Can someone try this? :-)
Perimeter sender should turn off after timeout
body: After robot has left charging station, perimeter sender should start a timeout. If that timeout time exceeds 5 hours, the perimeter sender should turn off by itself. This ensures the sender is not working for days even if the robot was forgotten to put back into charging station.

title: Tracking does not work when odometryUse==False
body:
When odometryUse==False the motors are not controlled in tracking mode. 
When going home, the mower turns sharply right as soon as the perimeter is crossed and goes to tracking mode. As the motors are not controlled in tracking mode, the mower keeps spinning.
This was observed with 1.0a4, unknown if this issue was also in other versions

title: System freezes when I2C does not work (also issue #47)
Perimeter plot can freeze
body:
The problem is caused by the fact that ADCMan captures the perimeter samples and that there are 2 consumers for the data while this is not really supported by ADCMan

Perimeter will poll for ADCMan.isCaptureComplete(idxPin[idx]) for the perimeter signal to be available, will consume it and invalidate it via ADCMan.restart(idxPin[idx]); 
Pfod does that too. If periodically (but much much slower) polls for the capture to be available, but it has to be lucky that Perimeter has not invalidated it in the meantime. And when pfod fails to get the data, it has it takes >200ms for pfod to try it again. 
It can now happen that both get synchronized and that Pfod has a very hard time getting the data. This can go one for minutes, sometimes the synchronization is broken after a while and the plot goes on. 
It must be mentioned that I have this on a slight modified code (with less ADCs to monitor) and that this unfortunate synchronization may not happen in the released versions. However, this shows that any seemingly unrelated change in the code can cause this perimeter plot mechanism to start failing.

Here a few scope plots. The blue line is high when the ADC data is available; the red line toggles when pfod tries to get the data. Here are examples where pfod is not able to get the data and this can go on for minutes

![20150711-0001](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11998085/8634250/2ab54d04-27f2-11e5-81d3-41c5a7c10f83.png)
![20150711-0002](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11998085/8634251/2acd26cc-27f2-11e5-8ad5-c719c6580a73.png)

title: Serielle Konsole hängt sich auf
body:
habe gerade auf ein leeren Mega  die aktuelle Software aufgespielt:
im serielle Monitor bekomme ich folgende Meldung:
SETUP
ADCMan error: no calib data
matchSignal size=48
capture size=240
## IMU error: no calib data

accOfs=0.00,0.00,0.00
accScale=2.00,2.00,2.00
comOfs=0.00,0.00,0.00
## comScale=2.00,2.00,2.00

initL3G4200D

dann friert die anzeige ein
Hatte in der Mover Cpp alle Sensoren deaktiviert

das einfrieren war erst weg als ich den IMU angesteckt hatte.
wird evl trotz deaktivierten IMU beim Start der seriellen Konsolle nach dem IMU gesucht und auf antwort gewartet?

title: optimize default mower motor max power / wait time for blocked blade
body:
A motor driver SF/error disables driver (enable pin):

Start current:
http://wiki.ardumower.de/images/c/cd/Mower2_start_current.png

Blocked mower blade (500 ms detection time, 5s wait time):
http://wiki.ardumower.de/images/1/18/Mower4_blocked_500ms_detect_5s_wait.png

In the Ardumower current code (detection time and very short wait time), the max. allowed power is 45 Watt (parallel dual driver) for no driver error to appear.

=> This power level could be set higher if the wait time is extended to 5 seconds.

title: RTC should be optional for timer
body:
Either GPS or RTC (or both) should work for the timer.

-add an settings option 'useRTC', indicate RTC comm/data errors via error counters
-make RTC optional

title: If settings lost, Ardumower should go into WARNING
body:
We could need some indication to the user for lost settings (e.g. due to an software update).

If settings are lost, Ardumower should go into a new state ERR_EEPROM, so user can check and save settings to turn off that error.
